title: Stationary vs Stationery
explanation: Use 'stationary' to describe something not moving, and 'stationery' for writing materials.

title: Their, There, They're
explanation: Use 'their' for possession, 'there' for location, and 'they're' as a contraction of 'they are.'

title: Ensure vs Insure
explanation: Use 'ensure' to mean guarantee and 'insure' for references to insurance.

title: Lose vs Loose
explanation: Use 'lose' when something is missing, and 'loose' when something is not tight.

title: Your vs You're
explanation: Use 'your' as the possessive form of 'you' and 'you're' as the contraction for 'you are'.

title: Accept vs Except
explanation: Use 'accept' to agree or receive something and 'except' to exclude something.

title: Advice vs Advise
explanation: Use 'advice' as a noun to mean a suggestion and 'advise' as a verb meaning to recommend.

title: Lead vs Led
explanation: Use 'lead' as the present tense of the verb meaning to guide, and 'led' as the past tense.
